bow: please help me with my 15 month old sleep troubles eating and clinginess am at my wits end please help me out have 15 month old boy and breastfeeding is going fine my problem is with **disciplining him and getting time for myself ** he does not like solids much as he knows that he will get breast milk any time but not having solids makes him hungry and cranky and can not afford to have him at the breast all the time don wear him as have bad back he is very clingy and he wakes up the moment do and needs to be carried around after that our mornings are rush so it is hard to get things done while carrying big baby around pee poo and brush while holding him and nursing him and that makes him slightly better while saving me time but need to cook and pack food too and can hold him when do he goes to daycare from to which is good for my sanity but the moment pick him up at pm he cries for boob so nurse him in the car suspect that fills him up so he doesn want to eat dinner at all gets angry and throws food around till give up nurse him but he nurses for ages and sometimes he doesn fall asleep so the half hour or one and half hours spent awake in bed doing nothing were waste realized that can have even little bit of chocolate or his sleep is affected coffee seems okay the effects do not last as long as for chocolate need to throw out the granola bars that bought without knowing they had chocolate it is too tempting to have it if it is in sight sometimes make him sleep and change my shirt and put my old shirt near him this way can go finish my task without him waking up go in and periodically swap my shirt so that he can still smell me near him my questions **how do make mealtime easier ** he eats well at the daycare yesterday drove back home from daycare without nursing him in the car and he cried murder for few minutes and was fine and we distracted him by taking him to the park afterward so he was hungry enough at dinner time doubt we can take him to the park every day especially with the crazy weather in my place **how do make nap times easier ** how can we get him to sleep if am not around to nurse him my family is pressuring me to stop breastfeeding since my life now revolves around nursing him and also since by not sleep training him am inconveniencing the rest of my family who have to step in and help he sleeps at the daycare because the lady is kind enough to make him sleep on her shoulder and she experienced enough to make it work in the last two weeks she could transition him from her shoulder to her bed near her but not to his nap mat my family has not been able to do it he is basically clingy because my parents left fortnight back and he went nuts at home cause he was always surrounded by people and now there was only me so he is still clingy and cries when leave him at the daycare and cries at home if am doing something else **how do imake him feel more secure ** unrelated to breastfeeding the daycare provider mixes honey and lemons in his water to make him drink more water it is as sweet as lemonade should ask her to dilute it further i** concerned about him having sweets** but thought honey is good since it is natural but like it to be in moderation too update since he came down with fever on friday evening ve been nursing him kinda non stop and giving him lots of attention he still is cranky in the morning and through the night thats new problem but hopefully is temporary but otherwise he fine and loving the attention he even was comfortable to leave my side and go play in the daycare when left him usually he clings to my side and cries when leave think the loads of attention did go him good for once going to incorporate all your suggestions in the future thanks ve crossposted this from breastfeeding boys need there moms emotionally and physically lot yours does sound extreme though may ask are you cosleeping being separated during daycare hours is emotional difficult for young kids boys even more so as society we pretend otherwise cosleeping during the night can reassure him and build his confidence in you presence being in contact during the night might make your days easier on you both because he will feel more secure time to set some rules and stick to them get him off milk onto foods if hes hungry he will eat get him somewhere you can put him to sit where he can see you while you do stuff and do the stuff you need if he cries talk to him reassure him you are there but dont pick him up know it seems harsh but its whats got to be done or you will never get your life back break the bad habits now you dont have to take him to the park every day play at home go to the store do something but dont feed him give him bottle of water or weak juice if needs be but dont breast feed hate to sound horrible but you have to set rules and stick to them hes safe you are nearby but you dont have to be holding him he wont starve he wont die from exposure you will have to put him down before he gets so big he hurts to lift be strong smile laugh sing and carry on he will get used to it totally agree with everything you said but my daughter did start sleeping through the night until she slept in her own crib and was weaned off the breast 18 months found even though she was with dad while was at work she was very clingy to nurse and woke up very suddenly if rolled over in bed and would go back to sleep until she nursed so she was only getting hours of sleep at night and maybe or hours of nap if she would go this made her very clingy and did want to eat much either in the morning eventually had to let her cry it out in her crib but she only cried for 10 minutes the first time and by day no crying at all once she learned to self soothe she stopped asking for the breast and she weaned herself her mood improved and she became bit more independent but not distant by any means she now sleeps 10 or 11 hours night with no wake ups and naps for or hours some days she does nap but think it due to teething all babies are different cosleeping is awesome and would have done it any other way but by the time she was 16 months old it stopped working for us breast feeding is always tough one too it such an amazing thing and some babies do want to let go guess do have any actual advice just sharing my experience did have any friends who breastfed anywhere near as long as me so had little advice throw them in the crib and they ll fall asleep was the only one and it actually worked but know that got lucky and was super lucky she weaned herself think she asked for it once momma bub and was like no baby big girls do bub want cup of milk and that was the end of it breastfeeding and being held should never be called bad habits it is nurturing your child they should after the child exits the needs only stage and demands it so often that it is affecting the quality of life for the mother but milk ideally should make up good chunk of his calories still and it still carries all the benefits it did for infants it sounds like she is only feeding him three times day which is lot for the op can you get up bit earlier in the morning have nice snuggles and milk time before starting your day then stick baby in the high chair with solids breakfast while you cook and pack lunches do worry if he wo eat much for dinner he might be too tired to eat solid food can you offer snack in the car on the way home and only nurse when you get home will someone else take over bedtime after he nurses but does go down maybe dad can rock and snuggle bit while he drifts off my doctor says not to give honey under the age of due to risk of botulism he at daycare from am to pm holding child every second of the day is not good for them they need to be put down to learn to explore to examine thir surroundings to learn the limitations of social interractions by holding that child every second you are teaching them to be clingy to breast feed them when you know its insufficient for their needs because they are cranky and unsatisfied and temporary filling them so they dont get the sustenance from eating solids then yes would call it bad habit the child is no longer baby it needs to learn to explore socialise and eat for the sake of its development this but this kid is if read the post right in day care from am to pm he trying to get whole day worth of mommy time out of couple of hours in the morning and before bedtime bet his demands would actually decrease substantially if she were to pull him from daycare or reduce his time there to half days assuming she is able to do that of course omg you sound exactly like me my 15 month old is almost exactly the same eatings been super difficult but ve found out some things that worked for me chew up whatever eating till its kinda puréed then spit it onto my finger and hell eat that ve also taken bananas frozen strawberries and milk mixed them in blender and let him practice drinking that from straw ve been putting ice cold water into sippy cup for him and have him drink that any time he thirsty it gotten to the point where he only nurses when he naps or is cranky also give him boiled carrot strips which he seems to like give him food he can experiment with like boiled broccoli carrots or other soft but firm foods let him learn food is fun and he ll enjoy eating remember that kids this age are picky eaters so do get stressed if he does eat lot everyday besides he still getting nourishment from breastfeeding so it not the end of the world if he does eat more than bite of solids day you can also make freeze pops of the fruit smoothie thing mentioned earlier for him to suck on if his teeth hurt too bad from teething you can even pump breast milk and make the popsicles out of that walmart is selling the freeze pop makers for like right now my son loves them still have figured the nap thing basically set up laptop next to my bed and surf the web while he naps on me ve changed his sleeping schedule from awake 2hrs gt nap gt awake 3hrs gt nap gt awake 4hrs gt bed to awake 2hrs gt nap gt awake 3hrs gt nursing session gt awake 4hrs gt bed which has helped cut back on how long stuck in bed but on days where his teeth are killing him go back to the old nap schedule my sons super clingy now too it just the age they re at not much you can do but get through it remember that he nurses for comfort too and sometimes uses it as reassurance that you re there for him and that everything is okay it ll go away eventually and when it gone you
